section.title: Should, shouldn't, can and can't
section.sectiontitle: Use should to say that something is a good idea. Use shouldn't to say something is not a good idea. Use subject + should(n't) + verb (without to).
section.text2a: You shouldn't eat lots of sweets.
section.sectiontitle2: Use can to say that something is possible. Use can't to say something is not possible. Use subject + can('t) + verb (without to).

section.title: Have to and don't have to
section.sectiontitle: Use have to to say that something is necessary. Use don't have to to say something is not necessary.
section.text1: Children go to school in the UK.
section.text1a: Children have to go to school in the UK.
section.text2a: I don't have to work on Sundays.
